page.title: 01Summary of the Area
page.content: This D block covers a region South of Wem and north of Shrewsbury. It is a rural area for the most part, with the village of Clive in the far S.E. corner being the only major area of housing. This is a medium sized village by Shropshire standards, and is situated at the western end of Grinshill. It has close connections with the village of Grinshill which is further east along the scarp slope of the hiil. Grinshill can be easily spotted by a distant observer by the beacon of red lights at its summit, to guide aircraft at R.A.F. Shawbury. The rest of the D block area is gently undulating, made up of farmland used for the most part as grassland for cattle and fodder crops.Some cash crops are grown such as oil-seed rape. The only exception to the farmland is the civil airfield at Sleap in the N.W
